types.name: Action
types.description: Action describes user intention to resolve & execute a given Interface or Implementation.

fields.name: actionRef
fields.description: Contains reference to the Implementation or Interface manifest

fields.name: cancel
fields.description: Indicates if user canceled the workflow. CURRENTLY NOT SUPPORTED.

fields.name: dryRun
fields.description:
Specifies whether the Action performs server-side test without actually running the Action.
For now it only lints the rendered Argo manifests and does not execute any workflow.

fields.name: renderedActionOverride
fields.description: CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED.

fields.name: renderingAdvancedMode
fields.description: CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED.

fields.name: run
fields.description: Indicates if user approved this Action to run

types.name: ActionDetailsInput
types.description: Client input of Action details, that are used for create and update Action operations (PUT-like operation)

inputFields.name: actionRef
inputFields.description: Contains reference to the Implementation or Interface manifest

inputFields.name: advancedRendering
inputFields.description: Enables advanced rendering mode for Action. CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED.

inputFields.name: dryRun
inputFields.description:
Specifies whether the Action performs server-side test without actually running the Action
For now it only lints the rendered Argo manifests and does not execute any workflow.

inputFields.name: renderedActionOverride
inputFields.description: Used to override the rendered action. CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED.

types.name: ActionFilter
types.description: Set of filters for Action list

types.name: ActionInput
types.description: Describes input of an Action

fields.name: actionPolicy
fields.description: Contains the one-time Action policy, which is merged with other Capact policies

fields.name: parameters
fields.description: Validated against JSON schema from Interface

types.name: ActionInputData
types.description: Client input that modifies input of a given Action

inputFields.name: actionPolicy
inputFields.description: Contains the optional one-time Action policy, which is merged with other Capact policies

inputFields.name: parameters
inputFields.description: During rendering, it is validated against JSON schema from Interface of the resolved action

inputFields.name: typeInstances
inputFields.description: Required and optional TypeInstances for Action

types.name: ActionOutput
types.description: Describes output of an Action

types.name: ActionRenderingAdvancedMode
types.description: Properties related to Action advanced rendering. CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED.

fields.name: typeInstancesForRenderingIteration
fields.description: Optional TypeInstances for current rendering iteration

types.name: ActionStatus
types.description: Status of the Action

fields.name: canceledBy
fields.description: CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED.

fields.name: createdBy
fields.description: CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED.

fields.name: runBy
fields.description: CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED.

types.name: ActionStatusPhase
types.description: Current phase of the Action

types.name: AdvancedModeContinueRenderingInput
types.description: Input used for continuing Action rendering in advanced mode

inputFields.name: typeInstances
inputFields.description: Optional TypeInstances for a given rendering iteration

types.name: Any
types.description: Arbitrary data

inputFields.name: revision
inputFields.description: If not provided, any revision of the Attribute applies to this filter

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

inputFields.name: alias
inputFields.description: Used to define the relationships, between the created TypeInstances

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

fields.name: runnerInterface
fields.description: The Interface or Implementation of a runner, which handles the execution, for example, cap.interface.runner.helm3.run

fields.name: revision
fields.description: If not provided, latest revision for a given Interface is used

fields.name: alias
fields.description: If provided, the TypeInstance of the Type, configured in policy, is injected to the workflow under the alias.

fields.name: valueConstraints
fields.description:
Holds the configuration constraints for the given entry based on Type value.
Currently not supported.

types.name: ImplementationRevisionFilter
types.description:
Dedicated input type for filtering ImplementationRevisions in future resolver
`InterfaceRevision.implementationRevisionsForRequirements`.

Currently used only for Hub Go client package as the server-side resolver is not implemented.

inputFields.name: requiredTypeInstancesInjectionSatisfiedBy
inputFields.description:
Filter by Implementations, which have requirements injection satisfied.
If provided, all TypeInstance values are merged into `requirementsSatisfiedBy` filter values, and, in a result,
both filters `requirementsSatisfiedBy` and `requiredTypeInstancesInjectionSatisfiedBy` are used.

inputFields.name: requirementsSatisfiedBy
inputFields.description:
If provided, Implementations are filtered by the ones that have satisfied requirements with provided TypeInstance values.
For example, to find all Implementations that can be run on a given system, user can provide values of all existing TypeInstances.

inputFields.name: requires
inputFields.description:
If provided, the ImplementationRevisions for a given Interface will be filtered
according to provided Type references looked up in the `Implementation.spec.requires` field.

For every item in the array, the returned ImplementationRevisions must specify
such TypeReference in `Implementation.spec.requires` in any of the sections: oneOf, anyOf or allOf.

types.name: InputTypeInstanceData
types.description: Client input for Input TypeInstance

types.name: InputTypeInstanceDetails
types.description: Describes input TypeInstance of an Action

types.name: InputTypeInstanceToProvide
types.description: Describes optional input TypeInstance of advanced rendering iteration

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: JSON
types.description: Arbitrary input data in JSON string format

types.name: LockOwnerID
types.description: LockOwner defines owner name who locked a given TypeInstance

inputFields.name: path
inputFields.description: Full path for the manifest

inputFields.name: revision
inputFields.description: If not provided, latest revision for a given manifest is used

fields.name: cancelAction
fields.description: CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED.

fields.name: continueAdvancedRendering
fields.description: CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED.

fields.name: deleteAction
fields.description: DeleteAction does not remove the resources, which were created or modified by this Action.

fields.name: lockTypeInstances
fields.description:
Mark given TypeInstances as locked by a given owner.
If at least one TypeInstance is already locked with different OwnerID, an error is returned.

fields.name: unlockTypeInstances
fields.description:
Remove lock from given TypeInstances.
If at least one TypeInstance was not locked by a given owner, an error is returned.

types.name: NameRegex
types.description: Regular expression for searching Action by name, e.g. upgrade-*

types.name: NodeName
types.description: Name of a given node. Name is immutable between different revisions of a given node.

types.name: NodePath
types.description: Full path of a given node, e.g. cap.core.type.platform.kubernetes

types.name: NodePathPattern
types.description: Pattern of the path of a given node, e.g. cap.core.type.platform.*

types.name: NodePrefix
types.description: Path for the parent node, e.g. for Interface it is InterfaceGroup path.

types.name: OutputTypeInstanceDetails
types.description: Describes output TypeInstance of an Action

fields.name: attributes
fields.description: Refers a specific Attribute by path and optional revision.

fields.name: path
fields.description: Refers a specific Implementation with exact path.

fields.name: requires
fields.description: Refers a specific required TypeInstance by path and optional revision.

inputFields.name: attributes
inputFields.description: Refers a specific Attribute by path and optional revision.

inputFields.name: path
inputFields.description: Refers a specific Implementation with exact path.

inputFields.name: requires
inputFields.description: Refers a specific required TypeInstance by path and optional revision.

types.name: RunnerStatus
types.description: Additional Action status from the Runner

fields.name: status
fields.description: Status of a given Runner e.g. Argo Workflow Runner status object with argoWorkflowRef field

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: Timestamp
types.description: Time in ISO 8601 format

fields.name: typeRef
fields.description: Common properties for all TypeInstances which cannot be changed

types.name: TypeInstanceInstrumentation
types.description: CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED

types.name: TypeInstanceInstrumentationHealth
types.description: CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED

types.name: TypeInstanceInstrumentationHealthStatus
types.description: CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED

types.name: TypeInstanceInstrumentationMetrics
types.description: CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED

types.name: TypeInstanceInstrumentationMetricsDashboard
types.description: CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED

fields.name: uses
fields.description: Contains list of Type Instance names, which a given TypeInstance uses (depends on)

fields.name: instrumentation
fields.description: CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED

inputFields.name: from
inputFields.description: Can be existing TypeInstance ID or alias of a TypeInstance from typeInstances list

inputFields.name: to
inputFields.description: Can be existing TypeInstance ID or alias of a TypeInstance from typeInstances list

inputFields.name: value
inputFields.description:
Currently not supported.
Value of the available requirement. If not provided, all valueConstraints conditions are treated as satisfied.

inputFields.name: revision
inputFields.description: If not provided, it returns TypeInstances for all revisions of given Type

types.name: UpdateTypeInstanceInput
types.description: At least one property needs to be specified.

inputFields.name: attributes
inputFields.description: The attributes property is optional. If not provided, previous value is used.

inputFields.name: value
inputFields.description: The value property is optional. If not provided, previous value is used.

inputFields.name: ownerID
inputFields.description:
Allows you to update TypeInstances which are locked by a given ownerID. If not provided,
you can update only those TypeInstances which are not locked.

types.name: UserInfo
types.description: Stores user information

types.name: Version
types.description: Version in semantic versioning, e.g. 1.1.0

types.name: VersionRange
types.description: Range of versions, e.g. "1.14.x, 1.15.0 - 1.15.3"

types.name: _Neo4jDate
types.description: Generated Date object type for Neo4j [Temporal fields](https://grandstack.io/docs/graphql-temporal-types-datetime#using-temporal-fields-in-queries).

fields.name: formatted
fields.description: Outputs a Neo4j [Temporal](https://grandstack.io/docs/graphql-temporal-types-datetime#using-temporal-fields-in-queries) Date value as a String type by using the [toString](https://neo4j.com/docs/cypher-manual/current/functions/string/#functions-tostring) Cypher function.

types.name: _Neo4jDateInput
types.description: Generated Date input object for Neo4j [Temporal field arguments](https://grandstack.io/docs/graphql-temporal-types-datetime/#temporal-query-arguments).

inputFields.name: formatted
inputFields.description: Creates a Neo4j [Temporal](https://grandstack.io/docs/graphql-temporal-types-datetime/#using-temporal-fields-in-mutations) Date value using a [String format](https://neo4j.com/docs/cypher-manual/current/functions/temporal/date/#functions-date-create-string).

types.name: _Neo4jDateTime
types.description: Generated DateTime object type for Neo4j [Temporal fields](https://grandstack.io/docs/graphql-temporal-types-datetime#using-temporal-fields-in-queries).

fields.name: formatted
fields.description: Outputs a Neo4j [Temporal](https://grandstack.io/docs/graphql-temporal-types-datetime#using-temporal-fields-in-queries) DateTime value as a String type by using the [toString](https://neo4j.com/docs/cypher-manual/current/functions/string/#functions-tostring) Cypher function.

types.name: _Neo4jDateTimeInput
types.description: Generated DateTime input object for Neo4j [Temporal field arguments](https://grandstack.io/docs/graphql-temporal-types-datetime/#temporal-query-arguments).

inputFields.name: formatted
inputFields.description: Creates a Neo4j [Temporal](https://grandstack.io/docs/graphql-temporal-types-datetime/#using-temporal-fields-in-mutations) DateTime value using a [String format](https://neo4j.com/docs/cypher-manual/current/functions/temporal/datetime/#functions-datetime-create-string).

types.name: _Neo4jLocalDateTime
types.description: Generated LocalDateTime object type for Neo4j [Temporal fields](https://grandstack.io/docs/graphql-temporal-types-datetime#using-temporal-fields-in-queries).

fields.name: formatted
fields.description: Outputs a Neo4j [Temporal](https://grandstack.io/docs/graphql-temporal-types-datetime#using-temporal-fields-in-queries) LocalDateTime value as a String type by using the [toString](https://neo4j.com/docs/cypher-manual/current/functions/string/#functions-tostring) Cypher function.

types.name: _Neo4jLocalDateTimeInput
types.description: Generated LocalDateTime input object for Neo4j [Temporal field arguments](https://grandstack.io/docs/graphql-temporal-types-datetime/#temporal-query-arguments).

inputFields.name: formatted
inputFields.description: Creates a Neo4j [Temporal](https://grandstack.io/docs/graphql-temporal-types-datetime/#using-temporal-fields-in-mutations) LocalDateTime value using a [String format](https://neo4j.com/docs/cypher-manual/current/functions/temporal/localdatetime/#functions-localdatetime-create-string).

types.name: _Neo4jLocalTime
types.description: Generated LocalTime object type for Neo4j [Temporal fields](https://grandstack.io/docs/graphql-temporal-types-datetime#using-temporal-fields-in-queries).

fields.name: formatted
fields.description: Outputs a Neo4j [Temporal](https://grandstack.io/docs/graphql-temporal-types-datetime#using-temporal-fields-in-queries) LocalTime value as a String type by using the [toString](https://neo4j.com/docs/cypher-manual/current/functions/string/#functions-tostring) Cypher function.

types.name: _Neo4jLocalTimeInput
types.description: Generated LocalTime input object for Neo4j [Temporal field arguments](https://grandstack.io/docs/graphql-temporal-types-datetime/#temporal-query-arguments).

inputFields.name: formatted
inputFields.description: Creates a Neo4j [Temporal](https://grandstack.io/docs/graphql-temporal-types-datetime/#using-temporal-fields-in-mutations) LocalTime value using a [String format](https://neo4j.com/docs/cypher-manual/current/functions/temporal/localtime/#functions-localtime-create-string).

types.name: _Neo4jPoint
types.description: Generated Point object type for Neo4j [Spatial fields](https://grandstack.io/docs/graphql-spatial-types#using-point-in-queries).

types.description: Generated Point input object for Neo4j [Spatial field arguments](https://grandstack.io/docs/graphql-spatial-types/#point-query-arguments).

types.name: _Neo4jTime
types.description: Generated Time object type for Neo4j [Temporal fields](https://grandstack.io/docs/graphql-temporal-types-datetime#using-temporal-fields-in-queries).

fields.description: Outputs a Neo4j [Temporal](https://grandstack.io/docs/graphql-temporal-types-datetime#using-temporal-fields-in-queries) Time value as a String type by using the [toString](https://neo4j.com/docs/cypher-manual/current/functions/string/#functions-tostring) Cypher function.

types.name: _Neo4jTimeInput
types.description: Generated Time input object for Neo4j [Temporal field arguments](https://grandstack.io/docs/graphql-temporal-types-datetime/#temporal-query-arguments).

inputFields.name: formatted
inputFields.description: Creates a Neo4j [Temporal](https://grandstack.io/docs/graphql-temporal-types-datetime/#using-temporal-fields-in-mutations) Time value using a [String format](https://neo4j.com/docs/cypher-manual/current/functions/temporal/time/#functions-time-create-string).

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByURL`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.
